intro: Oreopanax lehmannii, commonly known as the Lehmann's arrowleaf, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the Andes of South America. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound, pinnate leaves that are often leathery and dark green. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are followed by berries that turn red when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
